Your Core Power Words come from your class.
Your Personal Power Words usually do, too.
Your Nova Power Words are freely chosen; up to four total.
Some Abilities let you add additional Power Words.
In addition, you can use Advances to add more Power Words after the completion of a Storyline.
You can use your Power Words in Power Displays, Stunts, or Combos.

A Power Display uses one of your Power Words plus an Approach.
You have 1 die per point of that Approach in your dice pool, plus 1 for the Power Word.
The first Power Word is free; each additional Power Word adds an additional die but costs 1 Might.

A Power Stunt uses two or more of your Power Words plus an Approach.
You have 1 die per point of that Approach in your dice pool, plus 1 for each Power Word.
The first Power Word is free; each additional Power Word adds an additional die but costs 1 Might.

A Power Power uses one or more of your Power Words plus an Approach, plus one or more Power Words from another Hero.
You have 1 die per point of that Approach in your dice pool, plus 1 for each Power Word.
The first Power Word for each Hero is free; each additional Power Word adds an additional die but costs 1 Might.

After you use a Power Word in a Power Display, Power Stunt, or Power Combo, it goes on Cooldown until the start of the next Hero Phase.
Power Words on Cooldown can't be used in other Heroes' Power Combos.

At the start of each Storyline, your Nova Power Words are locked and can't be used in Power Displays, Stunts, or Combos.
You unlock your Nova Power Words by marking all five of your Ideals.
When you unlock your Nova Power Words, reset your Might to its maximum value.

blocks.label: Acrobat
blocks.value: Reduce by 1 the cost to counter a Crisis move targeting only you.

blocks.label: Ace
blocks.value: Add 2 dice when you use a Vehicle power word to roll to advance any goal.

blocks.label: Brawler
blocks.value: Add 2 dice when you use an unarmed attack to advance the Smash goal.

blocks.label: Controller
blocks.value: Add 2 dice when you use a Power to advance the Outwit goal.

blocks.label: Demolisher
blocks.value: Add 2 dice when you roll to advance the Smash Goal.

blocks.label: Find WEakness
blocks.value: Add 2 dice when you roll with Suspense to advance the Smash Goal.

blocks.label: Frenzy
blocks.value: Add 2 dice when you use any Personal power word to advance the Smash Goal.

blocks.label: guerilla
blocks.value: Add 2 dice when you use a Scene power word to roll to advance any goal or add to the Teamwork Pool.

blocks.label: Interceptor
blocks.value: Reduce by 1 the cost to Take the Hit for someone else.

blocks.label: Inspiration
blocks.value: Add 2 dice when you roll to add to the Teamwork Pool or advance the Allay goal.

blocks.label: Harrier
blocks.value: Add 2 dice when you use a Flight power word to roll to advance the Outwit goal.

blocks.label: Jester
blocks.value: Add 2 dice when you use humor to advance the Outwit goal against someone less funny than you.

blocks.label: Martial Artist
blocks.value: Add 2 dice when you use an unarmed attack to advance the Outwit goal.

blocks.label: Makeshift Weapons
blocks.value: Add 2 dice when you use a scene power word to advance the Smash goal.

blocks.label: meteor
blocks.value: Add 2 dice when you use an unarmed attack to advance the Smash goal against someone who is slower than you.

blocks.label: Mediator
blocks.value: Add 2 dice when you roll to advance the Allay Goal.

blocks.label: Medic
blocks.value: Add 2 dice when you roll to advance the Rescue or Allay goals.

blocks.label: Non-Combatant
blocks.value: You aren't skilled at fighting, but somehow manage to avoid the worst of a fight. You can spend 1 Might or 1 Success from the Teamwork Pool to counter any Crisis Move affecting only you.

blocks.label: Rescuer
blocks.value: Add 2 dice when you roll to advance the Rescue Goal.

blocks.label: Sharpshooter
blocks.value: Add 2 dice when you use a ranged Weapon to advance the Smash goal.

blocks.label: Submariner
blocks.value: Add 2 dice when you roll to advance the Smash or Outwit goals while underwater. If you don't already know how to breathe underwater, you do now.

blocks.label: tactician
blocks.value: Add 2 dice when you roll to add to the Teamwork Pool.

blocks.label: warlord
blocks.value: Whenever any hero rolls to add to the Teamwork Pool, they increase the effectiveness of their roll by the Volume as long as they can see or hear you.

blocks.label: weapon master
blocks.value: Add 2 dice when you use a melee Weapon power word to roll to advance the Outwit goal.

You can record notes about the current, past, or future Storylines here.
Each Ideal is a single word.

You can include an Ideal in a die roll; when you do, add 2 dice to the dice pool and mark off the Ideal.
Alternately, you can mark off an Ideal at the end of a Vignette that focuses on that Ideal.

When all five of your Ideals are marked off during a Storyline, you unlock your Nova Power Words until the end of the Storyline.
Check the "Nova Power Words" checkbox on the "Power Words" page.
In addition, when you unlock all five Ideals, your Might is reset to its maximum value. Make this change on the "Basics" page.

At the start of each Volume, choose one scenario or situation you'd like your hero to face.
When you are the Storyline Hero, check off Opportunity at the end of the Storyline.
If you haven't checked off your Opportunity yet, you can change it to something else between Storylines.
You can record notes about future Opportunities for your Hero here.

At the end of each Storyline, choose one Advancement.
Some Advancements can only be chosen once per Volume; check those off when you pick an Advancement with a checkbox.

After any Storyline, you can make these changes to your Hero:
- Change one of your Ideals to any other word.
- Change your Opportunity if you haven't already completed your Storyline.
At the end of a Storyline where you are the Spotlight Hero, increase one Approach of your choice by 1.

Before the start of a new volume, do BOTH of the following:
- Pick a new Class ability from the new Volume or a previous Volume.
- Create a new Opportunity for the new Volume.

In additional, you can choose one or more of the following changes to your hero between Volumes:
- Switch one of your Personal Power Words for another from your class.
- Switch your Fighting Style to any other Fighting Style.
- Switch one of your Skill choices for another Skill.
- Change your Nova Words to any other two words.
- Choose a new Costume, Symbol, or Hero Name.

At the start of a Crisis, the Editor describes the scene where the Crisis is taking place, and lists the Scene Power Words.
You can suggest additional power words if you want.
You can record the Scene Power Words here.
If you want to take other notes about the scene, you can record those here.
In this step, the Editor and the players decide which Heroes are present at a scene (or nearby), and who is not.
Check the box if your Hero is present at the scene.
You can record the names of other Heroes who are present at scene if you wish.

If your Hero isn't present for a Crisis, you can take the Timely Arrival move during the Hero Phase.
Timely Arrival costs 5 from the Teamwork pool, but this number decreases by 1 after each Crisis Phase.
If 2 or more Heroes aren't present, any Hero who IS present can take the General Alert move during the Hero Phase. The cost is 1 from the Teamwork Pool per missing Hero; they arrive at the start of the NEXT Hero Phase.
You can record the names of other Heroes who aren't present here, if you want.
You can use this Tracker to note the cost of the Timely Arrival move.

At this step of the Crisis Countdown, the Editor defines which of four goals can be advanced in this scene, and what it takes to advance each one.
Once five goals (in any combination) are advanced, the Crisis is resolved.
You can use this section to record the information about Goals given to you by the Editor.
You can track how many goals have been advanced by using this tracker.
Check the box if this goal CANNOT be advanced during this Crisis.
Some Crises have special effects that happen when this goal is advanced. You can record that information here.

You can record miscellaneous notes about Goals here.

When the Crisis starts, every player makes a roll to build the initial Teamwork Pool. The Teamwork Pool is an abstract way of describing the factors that give the heroes the upper hand in resolving a Crisis.

If your hero is present at the scene of a Crisis, describe how your hero reacts when they become aware of the Crisis, and then make a roll using an Approach related to that reaction. Add the Effectiveness of that roll to the Teamwork Pool, along with the successes the other players roll for their heroes.

If your hero is NOT on the Scene, add 1 to the Teamwork Pool when it's being formed. During the Hero Phase of the Crisis, the heroes can spend from the Teamwork Pool to call in the remaining heroes.
You can use this to track the Teamwork Pool.
After this step, the Crisis begins with the Hero Phase, which is then followed by the Crisis Phase.
Be sure to go to the "Basics" page and reset your Health and Might to their maximum values!
Some Abilities may go off at this point. If you have an Ability that says it takes effect at the end of a Crisis Countdown, you can record that here so you don't forget about it.
This is a reference to the Crisis Countdown process.
